title: Swamp lizard

properties.value: The Swamp lizard is a two-handed Ranged weapon requiring level 30 in Attack, Ranged and Magic to wield. The required ammunition for the Swamp lizard is Guam tar.

content:
The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:Green salamander
This article is about the equippable weapon. For the Hunter creature, see Swamp lizard (Hunter).
Swamp lizard

Item ID10149

The Swamp lizard is a two-handed Ranged weapon requiring level 30 in Attack, Ranged and Magic to wield. The required ammunition for the Swamp lizard is Guam tar.

Despite being able to perform Magic and Ranged attacks, use of this weapon requires the user to be within Melee range of the target, potentially reducing these attack styles' practicality.

A player attacks using a salamander.

Swamp lizards may be obtained by trapping Swamp lizards (Hunter) using net traps, requiring level 29 Hunter, or by trading with other players.

When using the Scorch (Slash) and Blaze (Magic) attack styles, the attack speed is 5. When using the Flare (Range) attack style, the attack speed is 4, which is similar in concept to the Rapid style of most ranged weapons.

In its melee mode, the swamp lizard has a chance of inflicting poison starting at 6 damage.

Combat styles[edit | edit source]

Category: SalamanderCombat StyleStyle typeWeapon StyleExperienceInvisible Boost
ScorchSlashAggressiveStrength and Hitpoints+3 Strength
FlareRangedAccurateRanged and Hitpoints+3 Ranged
BlazeMagicDefensiveMagic and Hitpoints+3 Defence

Experience[edit | edit source]

While using the Ranged and Melee attack styles, combat experience is rewarded normally. Dissimilarly, the Magic attack style rewards experience at a halved rate (what would normally be compensated with a base per-cast exp amount with traditional spells).

Combat Style Type Experience
Scorch Slash S t r e n g t h E x p = 4 × D a m a g e {\displaystyle StrengthExp=4\times Damage}
Flare Ranged R a n g e d E x p = 4 × D a m a g e {\displaystyle RangedExp=4\times Damage}
Blaze Magic M a g i c E x p = 2 × D a m a g e {\displaystyle MagicExp=2\times Damage}


Maximum hit[edit | edit source]

Melee mode's damage potential is determined by the strength bonus of the salamander itself, which is +22 for a Swamp lizard (equivalent to a mithril longsword).

Ranged mode's damage potential is determined by the Ranged strength bonus of the tar used, which is +16 for the Guam tar used with a Swamp lizard (equivalent to a steel arrow).

The maximum hit for magic mode uses the "magic damage bonus" of the salamander. This bonus is not visible in the equipment stats, but is equal to 56 for the Swamp lizard.

The max hit (Hitmax) formula for salamanders is as shown in fig.1., where "Magic" is your visible magic level and "Bonus" is the "magic damage bonus" for the salamander, in this case 56. This gives us the formula for the Swamp lizard as shown in fig.2.

H i t m a x = ⌊ 1 2 + M a g i c ∗ ( 64 + B o n u s ) 640 ⌋ ( 1 ) H i t m a x = ⌊ 1 2 + M a g i c ∗ 120 640 ⌋ ( 2 ) {\displaystyle {\begin{aligned}Hit_{max}&=\lfloor {\frac {1}{2}}+{\frac {Magic*(64+Bonus)}{640}}\rfloor &&(1)\\Hit_{max}&=\lfloor {\frac {1}{2}}+{\frac {Magic*120}{640}}\rfloor &&(2)\end{aligned}}}

This means the Swamp lizard will have a max hit of 6 damage at the minimum 30 magic required to wield it, up to 19 damage at 99 magic.

Item sources[edit | edit source]

For an exhaustive list of all known sources for this item, see here (include RDT).

[[File:Swamp lizard detail.png|left|130px]]
The '''Swamp lizard''' is a two-handed [[Ranged]] weapon requiring level 30 in [[Attack]], [[Ranged]] and [[Magic]] to wield. The required ammunition for the Swamp lizard is [[Guam tar]].

Despite being able to perform [[Magic]] and [[Ranged]] attacks, use of this weapon requires the user to be within [[Melee]] range of the target, potentially reducing these attack styles' practicality.
[[File:Salamander attack.gif|frame|A player attacks using a salamander.]]
Swamp lizards may be obtained by trapping [[swamp lizard (Hunter)|Swamp lizards (Hunter)]] using [[net traps]], requiring level 29 [[Hunter]], or by trading with other players.

When using the Scorch (Slash) and Blaze (Magic) attack styles, the attack speed is 5. When using the Flare (Range) attack style, the attack speed is 4, which is similar in concept to the Rapid style of most ranged weapons.

In its melee mode, the swamp lizard has a chance of inflicting [[poison]] starting at 6 damage.

==Combat styles==
{{CombatStyles|Salamander}}

==Experience==
While using the Ranged and Melee attack styles, combat experience is rewarded normally. Dissimilarly, the Magic attack style rewards experience at a halved rate (what would normally be compensated with a base per-cast exp amount with traditional spells).
{| class="wikitable" 
|- style="font-weight:bold;"
! Combat Style
! Type
! Experience
|-
| Scorch
| Slash
| <math>StrengthExp = 4 \times Damage</math>
|-
| Flare
| Ranged
| <math>RangedExp = 4 \times Damage</math>
|-
| Blaze
| Magic
| <math>MagicExp = 2 \times Damage</math>
|}


==Maximum hit==
Melee mode's damage potential is determined by the strength bonus of the salamander itself, which is +22 for  a Swamp lizard (equivalent to a mithril longsword).

Ranged mode's damage potential is determined by the Ranged strength bonus of the tar used, which is +16 for the [[Guam tar]] used with a Swamp lizard (equivalent to a steel arrow). 

The maximum hit for magic mode uses the "magic damage bonus" of the salamander. This bonus is not visible in the equipment stats, but is equal to 56 for the Swamp lizard. 

The max hit (Hit<sub>max</sub>) formula for salamanders is as shown in fig.1., where "Magic" is your visible magic level and "Bonus" is the "magic damage bonus" for the salamander, in this case 56. This gives us the formula for the Swamp lizard as shown in fig.2.

<math>\begin{align}
Hit_{max} &= \lfloor \frac{1}{2} + \frac{Magic * (64 + Bonus)}{640} \rfloor && (1) \\
Hit_{max} &= \lfloor \frac{1}{2} + \frac{Magic * 120}{640} \rfloor && (2)
\end{align}</math>

This means the Swamp lizard will have a max hit of {{sprintfexpr|%d|floor(30*120 / 640 + 0.5)}} damage at the minimum 30 magic required to wield it, up to {{sprintfexpr|%d|floor(99*120 / 640 + 0.5)}} damage at {{sprintfexpr|%d|ceil((floor(99*120 / 640 + 0.5) - 0.5) * 640 / 120)}} magic.
